citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility is administering an expired analgesic drug to "Hamton", an adult male pot-bellied pig. The animal was
prescribed meloxicam for daily use and the drug on hand expired on 01 May 2025. Use of expired medical products are
not an appropriate method to prevent, control, diagnose or treat diseases and injuries in animals. Expired drugs may not
be fully effective at treating pain. The facility must ensure appropriate methods are in place to control, diagnose and treat
diseases and injuries, which includes the use of unexpired drugs.
Correct from this date forward of 15 July 2025.

An acquisition record for a red fox is incomplete. One adult male red fox was obtained on 28 May 2025 from a non-USDA
licensed individual and the record did not have the vehicle license number and State, and the driver's license number and
State of the person. Records containing the required information for animals disposed of, or acquired for, use in regulated
activities (including those offspring born on premises) are necessary to accurately track animals to ensure their humane
care and use. The licensee must make and maintain records of the inventory, acquisition and disposition of all animals
which fully and correctly disclose the required information in this subpart 2.75(b)(1).
Correct from this date forward of 15 July 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility is administering an expired analgesic drug to "Hamton", an adult male pot-bellied pig. The animal was 
prescribed meloxicam for daily use and the drug on hand expired on 01 May 2025. Use of expired medical products are 
not an appropriate method to prevent, control, diagnose or treat diseases and injuries in animals. Expired drugs may not 
be fully effective at treating pain. The facility must ensure appropriate methods are in place to control, diagnose and treat 
diseases and injuries, which includes the use of unexpired drugs. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 15 July 2025. 
2.75(b)(1)(iii) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
An acquisition record for a red fox is incomplete. One adult male red fox was obtained on 28 May 2025 from a non-USDA 
licensed individual and the record did not have the vehicle license number and State, and the driver's license number and 
State of the person. Records containing the required information for animals disposed of, or acquired for, use in regulated 
activities (including those offspring born on premises) are necessary to accurately track animals to ensure their humane 
care and use. The licensee must make and maintain records of the inventory, acquisition and disposition of all animals 
which fully and correctly disclose the required information in this subpart 2.75(b)(1). 
 
Correct from this date forward of 15 July 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representatives.
